problem_text:
Let R be a commutative Noetherian ring with 1, and Λ an R-algebra, which is finitely generated as R-module. Put T = {U ∈ Mod Λ | ∃ an exact Λ-sequence 0 → P → Λ(n) → U → 0 for some n, with Pm ∼= Λ(n)m for every maximal ideal m of R}.
Denote by G(T) the Grothendieck group of T relative to short exact sequences.
a) Describe G(T), in particular, what does it mean: [U] = [V ] in G(T)?
b) Conjecture: if dim(max(R)) = d < ∞, and there are two epimorphisms φ : Λ(n) → U, ψ: Λ(n) → V , n > d, and [U] = [V ] in G(T), then Ker φ = Ker ψ.
K. W. Roggenkamp
